alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 12:57AM CDT until May 11 at 8:54AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kansas... Sappa Creek At Oberlin 1sw affecting Decatur County. For the Sappa Creek...including Oberlin 1sw...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Sappa Creek At Oberlin 1sw. * WHEN...From early this morning to this morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water spreads over agricultural fields and low lying areas with actual water depth in creek at about 6 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.9 feet this evening. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 900 AM CDT.
